comment: At first, he seemed intimidating, but he's nice. He even let me turn in my lab report late. The main issue is that his voice isn't loud enough. Besides that, he's fine. He gives you example calculation papers at the end of the lab that are very helpful. Read through the instructions in the lab manual before class, and you'll be just fine.
Very rude, poor, and unclear grader who publicly and loudly berates and belittles students. He as reported multiple times for misconduct. Register at your own risk.
He is extremely rude, doesn't grade on time and will loudly berate and belittle students publicly. Register at your own risk.

Not so great! He is a nice person, however, he is not a great teacher in my opinion. During lab lecture, he talks for at least an hour and he explains the lab sometimes but his directions are not always clear. During the fall 2024 semester, he was a part time teacher so he did not provide a lot of help outside of class. His grading is very tough.

He's pretty good, in lab he's very willing to answer questions and explain things to you. Be warned, he is a pretty tough grader in that he takes off points for sigfigs and for 2 points off for percent errors over 10%. Takes maybe a day to reply back to emails. Although he is a bit tough, since he is clear and concise about what he wants.

Great guy. He basically gives you the answers for the lab reports since he shows you what to do and how. Funny guy but does grade tough on sig figs. He also likes a neat lab notebook so keep that in mind. I liked him and would take him again, very nice man.

He was alright. Sometimes he seemed scary, but he's really a nice guy. The way he helps is not that great though, asking him questions is a little hard and he doesn't respond to email quickly + he takes off a lot of petty points from lab reports (sig figs). What's nice though is that he gives pretty much all needed calculations for every lab report

This man is adorable, the sweetest and most helpful guy I have had. He has sample calculations that are very helpful and he makes sure we understand the subject before we leave the lab. Takes the entire 3 hours and does not respond to emails, heavy accent, but he is a wonderful guy and wants you to succeed. Take him, its worth the 3 hours spent.

TERRIBLE!! If you have the option to take someone else, please do! He is a bad teacher with a bad attitude who loves taking points off. His grading was so bad I had to go to other professors to double check my work because I was barley passing. Even after getting my work double checked he still would mark things wrong. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

ou will never leave lab without knowing what to do. He makes sure everyone finishes before showing in detail how to do the lab report. So if you ignore his attitude, he is a very dependable lab instructor. I could turn in my lab late if it was the same day (be nice and he shows some kindness)Gives reports back fast but inputs the grades very late!

You will never leave lab without knowing what to do. He makes sure everyone finishes before showing in detail how to do the lab report. So if you ignore his attitude, he is a very dependable lab instructor. I could turn in my lab late if it was the same day (be nice and he shows some kindness)Gives reports back fast but inputs the grades very late!

Really tough grader. Always check your significant figures for lab reports. Bring your notebook on the first day with the first lab procedure already written. He always explains how to do every calculation needed for the reports. Final wasn't hard. ASK HIM QUESTIONS! He is super accessible outside class. He's not lovely, but hes really good.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I Love Dr.Saleh. Was very helpful during labs and also showed you what to do beforehand, was a hard grader regarding sig-figs so beware of those and learn the rules. Other than that 10/10. Be respectful and follow the rules and he will return the same energy.

I love having Dr. Saleh for lab, we have to write a notebook and do prelab quizzes, but that is not unique to him. He explains the procedure well, even if it is not explained well in the lab manual. He is a tough grader, but he explains how to do all the necessary calculations, which makes it easier. Just pay attention to what he says.

He takes off for your own explanation of your own data. He lectured for about an hour and a half before we were even allowed to start the experiment then showed us exactly what to do so it was pointless. Misplaced lab report and blamed it on me and refused to grade the lab notebook with all of the work showing I had done the work. Take someone else

RUN! He is so rude and disrespectful towards his students. He is a tough grader. He lectures for an hour before the experiment and makes us stay after for calculations. He yells at his students if you do something he doesn't like. I don't know how he has good ratings. He is awful.

RUN. RUN FAR, FAR AWAY. He no longer uses labflow to grade. I've been getting 90s on my labs and my lab partner is barely passing theirs because of Dr. Saleh's really tough grading on sigfigs. He will stop what he's doing to tell you to put your phone away. Even tho he basically shows you what to do, it isn't worth it bcs his grading is so hard.

He was a chill professor but really strict with his grading. He did not tolerate talking nor using phones during his lecture. He was great with showing us how to perform the calculations but really strict with significant figures. He was also a bit slow with grading and would not place grades in D2L.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I have him for my Chem 1212 lab. He covers over what will be done in the lab and shows the calculations on the Labflow so you can take pictures for reference. Overall a great guy, he's tough on phones though and does not want to see them when he is talking.

Attendance is extremely mandatory. He showed us step by step how to do calculations, so it is a very easy A if you just follow his work. LabFlow automatically grades the lab numbers and he directly grades your work. HARD final. Slow grader. I don't even know what I got on my final or my last two labs. Weekly prelab quiz but 3 attempts so easy 100.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Loved his class! Goes over the entire lab for you so its hard to mess up. You will have to bring a lab notebook and have the entire lab written in it. Dont show up to class without it and DONT BE LATE. He definitely can pick and choose favorites but I didnt have an issue with him. Uses LabFlow. Will grade your notebook at the end of semester.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Participation matters

comment: He is a good lab professor in the classroom setting. He can be a bit harsh sometimes with students. He is very accommodating to students' needs outside of class. He BY FAR gives the most information about lab calculations. All you have to do is plug in your own numbers to his format and you'll be golden. Might take a bit longer to respond to email
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor was the best lab teacher Ive had at Kennesaw. He gives you all the information you need to succeed. Your grade is based on lab reports, pre-lab quizzes, and a final exam. If you have to take chem1212 lab I would definitely recommend taking this professor.

Had to take his saturday class but was totally worth it!! He really cares to teach, especially if ur confused. The only times he gets frustrated are when people do the opposite of what he says or enter class late. Just respect his time, put in the effort, and he will be amazing for you. His long tangents helped me understand lecture a lot more.

Very weird class to say the least. For a 1 hour credit, I found myself writing the entire lab procedure into my lab notebook before every class. On top of the huge work load, Dr. Saleh sometimes gets... well frustrated with his students. Hes intimating to his students which caused a weird atmosphere during lab. Besides this, its an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Cons: He may be difficult to understand due to the accent, he is not readily available, HATES tardiness, doesn't (clearly) answer questions, and doesn't put in grades until the last minute. Pros: He walks you through the lab (and the calculations you'll need) before you start and grades pretty leniently (I'd say). Study pre-lab quizzes for final!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I would call myself a good student. I do all assignments on time and complete every single notebook entry. Dr. Saleh seems like he would be nice outside of class, but in class is a different story. If you have something wrong with your notebook or your lab setup in anyway he becomes visibly and verbally frustrated. He raises his voice and is rude!!

Dr. Saleh was super intimidating at times but I eventually got used to him. Even though he might come off a bit rude, he actually wants the best for us. He wants to see us succeed. He always explains what to do in the labs beforehand and has set expectations. As long as you try your best and do your work on time you should get a good grade.

At first he was rude to a lot of students but he really wants us to psd the class. For every in person lab, I showed the calculations which makes it easy when doing the lab report. He is passionate about Chemistry and helps during labs. He doesnt respond to emails on time though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Overall he's a pretty laidback professor and as long as you pay attention and do your work, you're guaranteed an A in the class pretty much. He is also very understanding and caring toward his students.

Dr. Saleh was a laid back professor who was extremely nice. The first day of lab he was really intimidating but it was all fun after that. He does actually grade the lab reports but is not too picky. He is lenient on tuning things late so it's okay if you miss a few. Mostly got 90s on all of them. The final was hard as usual but ended up passing.

Its clear Professor Saleh genuinely cares about his students' success. He spends a long time going over calculations (you can't just leave after you finish), but it ultimately saves you time when actually doing the lab at home. Sometimes he looses patience with the students after he's gone over things many times. Hes very helpful and caring overall
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: He will walk through the lab you are doing in the beginning of class and at the end, he will go over almost every calculation you need. Make sure you take a picture of what he writes on the board before you leave so you can look back on it. If you are stuck on the lab any part of the lab, he will take over and fix it up for you! He is also SO SWEET
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He's amazing, I had him for a Saturday lab but he's very understanding and will let you go to a later lab if you are late. He gave you the answers before you left so it's an easy A. Just go to every lab and you'll be fine.

Please take Professor Saleh, he is amazing!! It was either take his 8am Saturday lab or take the lab over the summer and Im so glad I chose his lab! He does have long pre and post lectures however he will give you some of the answers to the lab report, and he is also a lenient grader. Definitely recommend!!
I took him for a Saturday lab and he was amazing! He is very helpful and is very clear in we he wants. He is also a funny and easygoing person. Would definitely recommend!
Worth sacrificing my Saturdays. Gives you all the answers to the lab reports before you leave. Pretty lenient with Sig figs and easy grader. Made 90+ on all lab reports

He is truly an amazing professor to have. He may be hard to understand at times but he truly cares for every student. He is typically accessible to ask about for materials, and he is a relatively lax grader. He guides you through every lecture and usually even provides answers to a good amount of the reports. His Saturday 11 am class was a blast.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: the BEST lab professor I've ever had. He basically does the lab reports for you. Even though it was an 8am saturday lab, i'm glad I went ahead and took it because he makes it so much more easy. He lets you turn it lab reports later in the day if you let him know you made a mistake. If you ask him a question about calculations, he will literally do

LOVED HIM. He seems a little weird at first but he grows on you. Really cares about your success and understanding and truly wants you do do well. Fair grader and you get what you work for. I took this class Saturday at 8am and I still loved it. If you want to learn, take his class for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Super nice lab professor who wants everyone to get an A. Take him for sure.,
Take him for lab. Fabulous lab professor! Loves to hand out a's. Best lab teacher at Kennesaw.

He comes off rude at the beginning but hes a very sweet man!! He is very helpful in class, and he wants you to understand, He lets you re-turnin reports for a better grade. He has an accent but if you don't understand, he's happy to repeat it for you. He shows you how to do the math for your lab report! I'm doing better in his class than in 1211L

He'll seem rude and impersonal at first, & his oratory skills are pretty awful (he's quiet & mumbles a lot), but trust me, strike up a casual convo with him; he's a REALLY nice guy! Very supportive too in terms of making sure you know the stuff. He's a tougher grader now, so I had to work hard to make an low A. Definite B if you take him though.

Compared to 1211L, 1212L is much more difficult and time consuming, so don't expect an easy A. I worked my butt off and made a B. Reason I said that is because Dr. Saleh isn't rated so high because he's easy, but because he's very helpful, and will literally show EVERY calculation (to the point of annoyance). No other instructor at KSU does that.

He's a bit harsher on grading now, & I thought he was overrated after seeing all the other reviews, but looking back now, I see how great he was. Compared to the lab instructors of my other friends, Dr. Saleh gave SO much more info regarding data and such. You might not like him at first, but eventually you will see why he has such a high rating.

Like someone said before, his grading on labs was more strict than usual this semester (even the TA noticed that). Final is curved 20 points, but that didn't help me move letter grades. His post lab lectures are LONG, but he gives you every imaginable detail(even what the graph slope should be!). He comes off a bit rude at first, but a great guy.

He became a bit more harsh of grading this semester (hence me getting a B), but nevertheless is a great choice for a lab instructor. You should get at least a B in this class, and he is a very nice man. He comes off harsh at first, but you will warm up to him. Even on a saturday, I recommend him!

Even tho i took him on a Saturday morning, but it was worth it honestly, compared to my  other friends that took other professors, attend lab, follow the lab manual, you should be good and you should get at least a B with him, he's a great grader! TAKE HIM, even if its on a Saturday morning.

On your lab reports the grading is not very clear. But he is a very sweet man and he cares and makes SURE you understand the material and that you're not just going through the motion of the lab report. He drags the lecture out and sometimes he confused himself when explaining things, but overall I loved him. I would take him again even at 8 AM.

Dr. Saleh was a pretty cool guy with a very good memory. Being that he teach mostly on Saturday, he makes sure you fully understand what you are suppose to do for your lab report. Take notes and ask for help if its needed. Will take again.

Dr. Saleh cares about your success in this class!! I had him for 1212L; he was always ready to answer questions and help in any way. After each lab  was completed, he would take the time out to work out the actual problems and show you what the graphs are supposed to look like for the reports due the following week. I would def. take him again!

Honestly  This Guy Was probabaly one of the best lab teachers ive ever had and im not exagerating although he has a bit of a accent trust me its not hard to understand.  He can look mean at first but trust me hes the sweetest guy ever and hes funny! He Helps you out no matter what and wants you to Get an A! :) take him!

He is very helpful and will go over calculations in class. Material is not easy on some labs, but he wants you to understand what to do for the lab reports. Will give a study guide for the final.  1212 lab is harder than 1211 labs.  There are a ton of graphs that are due in 1212L  Overall, good professor.  He clearly enjoys chemistry and teaching.

Professor Saleh wants you to do well. he explains all of the calculations that you have to do thoroughly and is willing to help you out. Also if you do pretty bad on a lab write up he gives you the chance to turn it in again. Even though it is on a saturday, he is highly recommended, Very helpful. overall he's great for lab!

He teaches 1212 Lab, & he's great. Very nice & he goes over all the calculations during class. 1212 is hard, & compared to other professors he's very lenient. He wants you to succeed & understand. He's awesome!

Great guy! He is more than helpful if you don't understand something and very lenient with grading. His voice may be intimidating at times, but he really seems like a sweetheart. I never made anything lower than a B on my lab reports (and they were not perfectly completed). Just make sure you have a good lab partner and you should be fine.
Amazing lab professor. He goes over anything and everything you might have questions on. Just don't be late for class.

I had him for lab, and at first I disliked the class, but he grows on you. He literally goes over all the calculations needed for the lab reports, and he will help you as much as possible. He does have an accent so make sure you listen carefully!

He has a little bit of an accent. However, he is an awesome professor that is willing to help anybody that asks. He likes to talk a lot but it is just to help you with your lab. He helped prepare me for higher level labs and the final. He seems very cold in the start but that is just his personality. Hes really a very nice guy and grades fairly.

He is probably the best teacher i have ever had....he make sure that everyone understands everything before you leave lab which is a huge thing because I have to explain things to many of my lecture class mates as their teachers don't explain anything....so far I have no made below a 98 on a lab report...As long as you put in the effort and listen you should get an A and an easy A at that :)

Dr. Saleh is definitely one to take. He goes over the labs very well beforehand and after everyone has finished up, he completely goes over calculations. You leave class knowing exactly how to do your reports. He does have a thick accent, but is not offended if you ask him to clarify what he said. He is very willing to help during labs.
Horrible. Really horrible. Hard to understand. I hated his lab so much I dropped it.
